sen.j: 世良親王（よよししんのう／ときながしんのう、生年不詳 － 元徳2年9月17日 (旧暦)（1330年10月29日））は、鎌倉時代後期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yoyoshi (aka Imperial Prince Tokinaga, Birth year unknown - October 29, 1330) was a member of the Imperial Family in the late Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: [http://koyomi8.com/i/i9reki.cgi]で計算すると、1330年10月29日の旧暦は1330年9月9日となり、原文が間違っている可能性があります。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yoyoshi (aka Imperial Prince Tokinaga, Birth year unknown - October 29, 1330) was a member of the Imperial Family during the late Kamakura Period.
Imperial Prince Yoyoshi (as known as Imperial Prince Tokinaga, birth year unknown - October 29, 1330) was a member of the Imperial family during the late Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: aka→as known as に訂正しました。Birthに訂正しました。familyに訂正しました。

sen.e: He was a prince of Emperor Godaigo.
He was the prince of Emperor Godaigo.
He was the prince of Emperor Godaigo.

sen.j: 母は西園寺実俊の娘遊義門院一条局。
sen.e: His mother was Yugimonin Ichijo no tsubone, a daughter of Sanetoshi SAIONJI.
His mother was Yugimonin Ichijo no tsubone, the daughter of Sanetoshi SAIONJI.
His mother was Yugimonin Ichijo no tsubone, the daughter of Sanetoshi SAIONJI.
His job grade was Dazaifu (Government Headquarters in Kyushu).
His job grade was Dazaifu (Government Headquarters in Kyushu).
His job grade was Dazaifu (Government Headquarters in Kyushu).

sen.j: 名前の読みが二種類あることについては、後醍醐天皇皇子の読みを参照。
sen.e: For the reason why his name has two ways of pronunciation, refer to "pronunciation of prince names of Emperor Godaigo."
sen.cmt: 「後醍醐天皇皇子の読み」の訳については、当該項目の英訳と一致させる必要があります。
sen.e: For the reason why his name has two ways of pronunciation, refer to "pronunciation of prince names of Emperor Godaigo."
For the reason why his name has two ways of pronunciation, refer to "pronunciation of prince names of Emperor Godaigo."

sen.j: 亀山天皇の皇女昭慶門院に養育され、北畠親房が乳父となった。
sen.e: He was nurtured by Shokeimonin, a princess of Emperor Kameyama, and his menoto (a foster father) was Chikafusa KITABATAKE.
He was nurtured by Shokeimonin, the princess of Emperor Kameyama, and his menoto (a foster father) was Chikafusa KITABATAKE.
He was nurtured by Shokeimonin, the princess of Emperor Kameyama, and his foster father was Chikafusa KITABATAKE.

sen.j: 兄の尊良親王よりも聡明で父後醍醐天皇の期待をかけられていたが、早世してしまった。
sen.e: Although he was cleverer than his elder brother, Imperial Prince Takayoshi, and therefore his father, Emperor Godaigo, put great expectations on him, he passed away young.
Although he was more clever than his elder brother, Imperial Prince Takayoshi, his father, Emperor Godaigo, placed great expectations on him, but he passed away while young.
Although he was more clever than his elder brother, Imperial Prince Takayoshi, his father, Emperor Godaigo, placed great expectations on him, but he passed away while young.

sen.j: 死に先立ち居所を禅院（現在の京都嵐山臨川寺）とし、昭慶門院から継承された所領を寄進した。
sen.e: Before his death, he located his domicile at a Zen temple (present-day Rinsen-ji Temple in Arashiyama, Kyoto City), and donated his territory inherited from Shokeimonin.
Before his death, his domicile was at a Zen temple (present-day Rinsen-ji Temple in Arashiyama, Kyoto City), and he donated his territory inherited from Shokeimonin.
Before his death, his domicile was at a Zen temple (present-day Rinsen-ji Temple in Arashiyama, Kyoto City), and he donated his territory inherited from Shokeimonin.
